column24: which led to the city being dubbed "The Egg Basket of America."Vineland Poultry Laboratories (operations were closed by Lohmann Animal Health in 2007) was started by Arthur Goldhaft. Dr. Goldhaft is credited with putting "a chicken in every pot" after developing the fowl pox chicken vaccine that saved millions of chickens from death. Dr. Goldhaft's work at Vineland Poultry Laboratories in Vineland helped protect the world's chicken supply from the fowl pox disease.

column1: Vineland had New Jersey's first school for the intellectually disabled
column2: the Vineland Developmental Center
column3: which now has an east and west campus. These institutions housed mentally handicapped women in fully staffed cottages. Henry H. Goddard
column4: an American psychologist
column5: coined the term "Moron" while directing the Research Laboratory at the Training School for Backward and Feeble-minded Children in Vineland. This facility was so sufficiently well known that one American Prison Association pamphlet in 1955 heralded Vineland as "famous for its contributions to our knowledge of the feebleminded".The city of Vineland celebrated its 150th birthday in 2011. Mayor Robert Romano initially ordered a custom cake from Buddy Valastro of Carlo's Bake Shop in Hoboken; the business is featured in the TLC reality television series Cake Boss. After outcry from local business owners
column6: the order was canceled and five Vineland bakeries were commissioned to create elaborate cakes for the event.Since the 1970s

column1: Portions of the city are part of a joint Urban Enterprise Zone (UEZ) with Millville
column2: one of 32 zones covering 37 municipalities statewide. Millville was selected in 1983 as one of the initial group of 10 zones chosen to participate in the program. In addition to other benefits to encourage employment and investment within the Zone
column3: shoppers can take advantage of a reduced 3.3125% sales tax rate (half of the ​6 5⁄8% rate charged statewide) at eligible merchants. Established in October 1988
column4: the city's Urban Enterprise Zone status expires in December 2023.The main street in Vineland is Landis Avenue. The traditional downtown area is located several blocks east and west of the intersection of Landis Avenue and the Boulevard. The Boulevard is a pair of roads that flank the main north–south railroad
column5: which connected Vineland with Cape May to the south and Camden/Philadelphia to the north. After many years of decline there has been much recent activity to restore the vitality of "The Avenue" and the center city area. New construction includes a new transportation center
column8: elementary school / community center and sidewalk upgrades. In 2005
column9: Vineland was designated a Main Street Community and

column11: money has been earmarked to continue this improvement through property and facade improvements

column1: The City of Vineland is governed within the Faulkner Act
column2: formally known as the Optional Municipal Charter Law
column3: under the Mayor-Council (Plan A)
column4: implemented based on the recommendations of a Charter Study Commission as of July 1
column6: months after the city's formation. The city is one of 71 municipalities (of the 565) statewide that use this form of government. The governing body is comprised of the Mayor and the five-member City Council. The mayor serves as the city's chief executive
column7: while the City Council is its legislative branch. The mayor and council are elected at-large to serve concurrent four-year terms of office in non-partisan elections held in leap years as part of the November general election. An ordinance passed by the council in 2011 shifted elections from May to November
column8: effectively extending the term of those members serving at the time by six months.As of 2020
column9: the Mayor of Vineland is Anthony Fanucci whose term of office ends on December 31
column11: along with those of all members of the City Council. Members of the Vineland City Council are Council President Paul F. Spinelli
column13: Elizabeth Arthur (elected to serve an unexpired term)
column14: Ronald John Franceschini Jr. and Albert Vargas.In November 2019
column15: the City Council appointed Elizabeth Arthur to fill the seat vacated by Angela Calakos following her resignation after announcing that she was moving out of the city. Arthur served on an interim basis until the November 2019 general election
column16: when she was elected to serve the balance of the term office.In January 2013
column17: Ruben Bermudez took office as the city's first Hispanic mayor.

column8: on the city's eastern border. County Route 552 (Sherman Avenue / Mays Landing Road) enters from Deerfield Township in the city's southwest corner and continues for 10.8 miles (17.4 km) into Maurice River Township. County Route 555 (South Main Road / North Main Road) enters from Millville extending for 8 miles (13 km) into Franklin Township.
